items.text: Insert PXE USB into laptop, turn machine on and press F10 until boot menu appears.
Change boot order to boot to USB first then save and restart device.
Ivanti template screen will populate, and you will navigate to the correct image.
After image runs, device will restart and load to the Windows log-in screen.
Remove the PXE USB drive.
Log into KNTAdmin and an Ivanti template should populate.
Sometimes this can take upwards of 10 minutes to show. If it does not show within that time, restart the imaging process.
Device will restart after a while.
Log in with your corp adm account at the next log-in and allow Ivanti template to run and complete.
Add the description for the device Users Name Shared , Company , Location.
Name the device.
Kent Laptop,Desktop,Thin Client , KLT KDT KTC
GPC Muscatine Laptop ,Desktop ,Thin Client , GLT GDT GTC
GPC Washington Laptop,Desktop , WLT,WDT
Verify device has Windows enterprise.
Run Windows Update.
Run HP Image Assistant
Install the latest Ivanti Agent.
Run Security Scan.
Verify the following software,agents are installed:
Cisco Any Connect.
Rapid7 Insight Agent
Ivanti Agent.
Office 365 Applications.
Install the requested software listed in the Service Request.
Reach out to the users supervisor if there are questions about the needed software.
Run Disc clean-up.
Run an inventory scan.
Check for device to show in Rapid7 with a score no more than 6k.
Verify device is enrolled in Intune.
Change device status to deploy in data analytics
Verify device shows with agent and device information in Ivanti Console.
Pass off to colleague to look over and initial
